page.title: 02CHICHESTER-SMUGGLER'S STONE
page.content: With it's proximity to the sea, times past have seen {Chichester }closely linked with smugglers &their exploits. The {"Smuggler's Stone",} Broyle Road tells of the burial near the stone of William Jackson a smuggler,who died a few hours after sentence of death was pronounced upon him. The{ Smuggler's {Stone }was erected "as a memorial to posterity and a warning to this and succeeding generations _ AD 1749". The smugglers of {Sussex }were incredibly daring & numerous. They openly defied the law & many stories remain of their exploits. {Brandy Hole Lane,}now a residential road, is said to be named after it's association with smuggling days _ the hiding place of the brandy! Smugglers' trials were held in the {Guildhall,Chichester.}Upon sentence of death, executions were carried out on {The Broyle,}now a residential area.
